sentence.Network_en: I had to wear long sleeves to stop myself scratching.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只好穿上长袖衣服以免自己挠痒。

sentence.Network_en: The mongrel presented his muzzle for scratching.
sentence.Network_cn: 那只杂种狗张嘴要伤人。

sentence.Network_en: It wasn't easy scratching out a living in those hard times.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那段艰难的日子里,糊口真不容易.

entry.def: If you scratch yourself, you rub your fingernails against your skin because it is itching.

example.ex: He scratched himself under his arm...
The old man lifted his cardigan to scratch his side...
example.tran: 老人撩起开襟毛衣挠了挠身体的一侧。

entry.def: If a sharp object scratches someone or something, it makes small shallow cuts on their skin or surface.

example.ex: The branches tore at my jacket and scratched my hands and face...
example.tran: 树枝刮破了我的夹克，划伤了我的手和脸。
小刀会在工作台上留下划痕。

entry.def: Scratches on someone or something are small shallow cuts.

example.ex: The seven-year-old was found crying with scratches on his face and neck...
example.tran: 那名 7 岁男孩被发现时正在哭泣，脸部和颈部都有划伤。

example.ex: I pointed to a number of scratches in the tile floor.
example.tran: 我指向地板砖上的一道道划痕。

entry.tran: 从零开始;从头做起;白手起家
entry.def: If you do something from scratch, you do it without making use of anything that has been done before.

example.ex: Building a home from scratch can be both exciting and challenging...
example.tran: 建立一个全新的家庭既让人兴奋又富于挑战。

example.ex: Hong Kong's manufacturing industry did not start from scratch in the post-war period.
example.tran: 战后，香港制造业的兴起并非从零开始。

entry.def: If you say that someone is scratching their head, you mean that they are thinking hard and trying to solve a problem or puzzle.

example.ex: The Institute spends a lot of time scratching its head about how to boost American productivity.
example.tran: 该协会花费大量时间苦苦思索如何提高美国的生产力。

entry.tran: 触及表面;隔靴搔痒;浅尝辄止
entry.def: If you only scratch the surface of a subject or problem, you find out or do a small amount, but not enough to understand or solve it.

example.ex: Officials say they've only scratched the surface of the drug problem...
example.tran: 官员们说他们只是触及了毒品问题的表面。

example.ex: We had only two weeks to tour Malaysia, which was hardly enough time to scratch the surface.
example.tran: 我们只有两周的时间游览马来西亚，连走马观花都来不及。

entry.tran: 达到标准;合格;令人满意
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is not up to scratch, you mean that they are not good enough.

example.ex: My mother always made me feel I wasn't coming up to scratch.
example.tran: 母亲总是使我觉得自己不够优秀。

means.word_mean: 1. a harsh noise made by scraping;

sentences.sentence: "the scrape of violin bows distracted her"

means.word_mean: 1. (of a pain) as if caused by scraping with nails or claws
